abstract: Google‘s $3.1 billion acquisition of online advertising firm DoubleClick drove up shares of other Internet ad firms. What was behind the rise? Many investors were betting that Microsoft (which was reportedly also in the running for DoubleClick) and Yahoo would be driven to make deals of their own to keep up with Google.
lead_paragraph: Google‘s $3.1 billion acquisition of online advertising firm DoubleClick drove up shares of other Internet ad firms. What was behind the rise? Many investors were betting that Microsoft (which was reportedly also in the running for DoubleClick) and Yahoo would be driven to make deals of their own to keep up with Google.

headline.main: DoubleCick Deal Puts Spotlight on Rivals
